abstract_problem:
A transportation provider plans a set of profitable vehicle operations while simultaneously building a feasible crew plan that can cover those operations. Both the vehicle side and the crew side are represented as discrete time-space transitions: selecting a transition means committing to a specific movement or linkage in the plan.

During the planning horizon, there are {num_start_slots} independent starting requirements. For each requirement, exactly one starting option must be chosen so that a corresponding operational stream can begin.

Some operational blocks are only meaningful if they are opened and properly anchored at both ends. The instance contains {num_packages} such blocks. When a block is opened, exactly two associated boundary choices must be selected.

Operational activity is paced across {num_windows} windows. In each window, the number of selected vehicle-side transitions must remain within a window-specific band and must not exceed a hard limit. In addition, there are {num_mix_dimensions} policy dimensions that limit how concentrated certain vehicle-side attributes can be among the selected transitions.

The plan must also satisfy minimum coverage expectations across {num_coverage_groups} groups and avoid incompatible combinations captured by {num_conflict_groups} conflict groups. Finally, some choices only make sense when at least one supporting continuation is also chosen, and some protected subsets are subject to additional cardinality caps.

Each selectable choice has a net cost that can be positive (expense) or negative (profit credit). The goal is to select a consistent set of choices that respects all operational rules and yields the minimum total net cost.

decisions.description:
All selectable choices in the plan. Each row is one binary choice with its role label and its net cost contribution in the objective. The decision identifier uses a stable, cleaned format.

Possible strings:
- decision_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., d000000.
- role: one of {vehicle_arc_or_trip, crew_block_or_vehicle_block, auxiliary_transition}.

Data format: | decision_id | role | cost |
|:--|:--|:--|
| <str> | <str> | <float> |
| ... | ... | ... |

start_slots.description:
Independent starting requirements. Each row identifies a start slot that must select exactly one associated option.

Possible strings:
- start_slot_id: 'S' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., S00.

Data format: | start_slot_id |
|:--|
| <str> |
| ... |

start_options.description:
Allowed starting options for each start slot. The options listed for a slot are the choices among which exactly one must be selected.

Possible strings:
- start_slot_id: 'S' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., S00.
- decision_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., d000000.

Data format: | start_slot_id | decision_id |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <str> |
| ... | ... |

flow_nodes.description:
Time-space balance nodes used to ensure internal consistency of vehicle and crew movement streams. Each node has a required net balance value.

Possible strings:
- node_id: 'c' followed by digits, e.g., c22.

Data format: | node_id | rhs |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <float> |
| ... | ... |

flow_arcs.description:
Directed transitions between flow nodes for decisions that follow the standard ‘leave one node and enter another’ pattern.

Possible strings:
- decision_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded).
- from_node, to_node: 'c' followed by digits.

Data format: | decision_id | from_node | to_node |
|:--|:--|:--|
| <str> | <str> | <str> |
| ... | ... | ... |

flow_exceptions.description:
Non-standard balance contributions for decisions that do not fit the simple directed-transition pattern.

Possible strings:
- decision_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded).
- node_id: 'c' followed by digits.

Data format: | decision_id | node_id | coef |
|:--|:--|:--|
| <str> | <str> | <float> |
| ... | ... | ... |

packages.description:
Operational blocks that, when opened, must be anchored by selecting exactly two associated boundary choices.

Possible strings:
- package_id: 'P' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., P0000.
- package_decision_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded).

Data format: | package_id | package_decision_id |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <str> |
| ... | ... |

package_candidates.description:
Boundary choices associated with each operational block.

Possible strings:
- package_id: 'P' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., P0000.
- candidate_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded).

Data format: | package_id | candidate_id |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <str> |
| ... | ... |

windows.description:
Pacing windows that limit how much vehicle-side activity can be scheduled in the window.

Possible strings:
- window_id: 'W' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., W000.

Data format: | window_id | min_count | max_count | hard_cap |
|:--|:--|:--|:--|
| <str> | <float> | <float> | <float> |
| ... | ... | ... | ... |

window_members.description:
Membership of decisions in each pacing window.

Possible strings:
- window_id: 'W' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., W000.
- decision_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded).

Data format: | window_id | decision_id |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <str> |
| ... | ... |

mix_targets.description:
Share-limit targets for each policy dimension.

Possible strings:
- mix_dimension_id: 'D' followed by digits, e.g., D0.

Data format: | mix_dimension_id | max_share |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <float> |
| ... | ... |

mix_flags.description:
Binary attribute flags for vehicle-side decisions under each policy dimension.

Possible strings:
- decision_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded).
- mix_dimension_id: 'D' followed by digits.

Data format: | decision_id | mix_dimension_id | flag |
|:--|:--|:--|
| <str> | <str> | <int> |
| ... | ... | ... |

coverage_groups.description:
Minimum coverage expectations.

Possible strings:
- coverage_group_id: 'G' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., G0000.

Data format: | coverage_group_id | min_selected |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <int> |
| ... | ... |

coverage_members.description:
Membership of decisions in each coverage group.

Possible strings:
- coverage_group_id: 'G' followed by digits (zero-padded).
- decision_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded).

Data format: | coverage_group_id | decision_id |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <str> |
| ... | ... |

conflict_groups.description:
Groups of mutually incompatible choices.

Possible strings:
- conflict_group_id: 'C' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., C0000.

Data format: | conflict_group_id |
|:--|
| <str> |
| ... |

conflict_members.description:
Membership of decisions in each incompatibility group.

Possible strings:
- conflict_group_id: 'C' followed by digits (zero-padded).
- decision_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded).

Data format: | conflict_group_id | decision_id |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <str> |
| ... | ... |

dependencies.description:
Prerequisite links between choices.

Possible strings:
- parent_id, child_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded).

Data format: | parent_id | child_id |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <str> |
| ... | ... |

exact_choice_groups.description:
Groups where an exact number of member choices must be selected (may be empty for this instance).

Possible strings:
- exact_group_id: 'X' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., X000.

Data format: | exact_group_id | required_selected |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <int> |
| ... | ... |

exact_choice_members.description:
Membership of decisions in each exact-choice group.

Possible strings:
- exact_group_id: 'X' followed by digits (zero-padded).
- decision_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded).

Data format: | exact_group_id | decision_id |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <str> |
| ... | ... |

cardinality_caps.description:
Upper limits on how many member choices may be selected in a group.

Possible strings:
- cap_group_id: 'K' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., K000.

Data format: | cap_group_id | max_selected |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <int> |
| ... | ... |

cardinality_cap_members.description:
Membership of decisions in each cardinality-cap group.

Possible strings:
- cap_group_id: 'K' followed by digits (zero-padded).
- decision_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded).

Data format: | cap_group_id | decision_id |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <str> |
| ... | ... |

redundant_bounds.description:
Optional traceability bounds that are implied by the binary nature of the decisions and therefore do not change feasibility (may be empty for this instance).

Possible strings:
- decision_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded).

Data format: | decision_id | upper_bound |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <int> |
| ... | ... |
